      • isFormUrlEncoded

        public boolean isFormUrlEncoded()
        Returns true if application/x-www-form-urlencoded style separators are allowed for an implied top-level object or array.
        See Also:
        setFormUrlEncoded(boolean)

      • setFormUrlEncoded

        public void setFormUrlEncoded(boolean wwwFormUrlEncoded)
        Set this to true if you want to allow &amp to be used as a top-level value separator and = to be used as top-level name separator.
        Parameters:
        wwwFormUrlEncoded - true or false

      • isImpliedStringLiterals

        public boolean isImpliedStringLiterals()
        Returns true if all literals are assumed to be strings.
        See Also:
        setImpliedStringLiterals(boolean)

      • setImpliedStringLiterals

        public void setImpliedStringLiterals(boolean implied)
        Set this to true to assume all literals are strings.
        Parameters:
        implied - true or false

      • setImpliedStringLiterals

        public void setImpliedStringLiterals()
        Use this method to enable implied string literals and common related options.

        This is a convenience method for: 

           setEmptyUnquotedKeyAllowed(true);
   setEmptyUnquotedValueAllowed(true);
   setImpliedStringLiterals(true);

        If isImpliedStringLiterals() is true but isEmptyUnquotedValueAllowed() is false then an empty string literal value will trigger an Exception because there wouldn't be any way to represent it.

        If isImpliedStringLiterals() is true but isEmptyUnquotedKeyAllowed() is false then an empty key will trigger an Exception because there wouldn't be any way to represent it.

        If you want the above behavior, because your data doesn't support those cases and you want the parser to catch them for you, then call setImpliedStringLiterals(true) directly.

        See Also:
        setEmptyUnquotedKeyAllowed(boolean), setEmptyUnquotedValueAllowed(boolean), setImpliedStringLiterals(boolean)

      • isEmptyUnquotedKeyAllowed

        public boolean isEmptyUnquotedKeyAllowed()
        Returns true if empty, unquoted keys are allowed.
        See Also:
        setEmptyUnquotedKeyAllowed(boolean)

      • setEmptyUnquotedKeyAllowed

        public void setEmptyUnquotedKeyAllowed(boolean allow)
        Set this to true if you want to allow empty, unquoted keys. For example, (:value).
        Parameters:
        allow - boolean

      • isEmptyUnquotedValueAllowed

        public boolean isEmptyUnquotedValueAllowed()
        Returns true if empty, unquoted values are allowed.
        See Also:
        setEmptyUnquotedValueAllowed(boolean)

      • setEmptyUnquotedValueAllowed

        public void setEmptyUnquotedValueAllowed(boolean allow)
        Set this to true to allow empty, unquoted values. For example, (1,,3).
        Parameters:
        allow - boolean
